The movie "Taxi Driver" is based on a novel of the same name written by Martin Scorsese and Paul Schrader. The story revolves around Travis Bickle, an emotionally disturbed man who lives in New York City. Travis works at a convenience store called Joe's. He spends most of his time watching news programs and reading newspapers. On one particular day, Travis goes out to buy some newspapers for himself. While he is outside buying the newspapers, he notices two thugs who are beating up another man who they think has something that they want. Travis is extremely emotionally disturbed, so he decides to do something about it. He grabs his New York City Police Department badge off of his shirt pocket and walks over to where the two thugs are beating up the other man. Travis stands in front of the two thugs and holds out his badge.

conversation.text: Based on your preference cues, I recommend watching "The Fighter." The film stars Dicky Eklund and Melissa McMeekin, and tells the story of Micky Ward, a fledgling boxer who tries to escape the shadow of his more famous but troubled older boxing brother and get his own shot at greatness.
